item.title: The SECRET tool that most businesses ignore...

item.content:encoded:
What makes someone buy a product?

What makes YOU purchase?

“Well, I rationally put together the facts, and then…”

No, you don’t.

When you click the “Buy” button, it’s an impulsive act.

A quick emotional response.

Triggered by your caveman brain.

Sure, you might rationalize it before and after.

…but the most important action is based on your sensitive feelings.

Many businesses ignore this fact; ALL of your competitors do.

Writing is a medium that can heavily influence your emotions, yet it requires more sophistication than film.

I can’t just put in a quick and scary jump scare or a Michael Bay-style explosion.

Wait, I just did, and it played in your head.

Copywriting is an essential skill for making it online or anywhere in the world.

With that in mind, I hugely reworked my site.

P.S. Any feedback is appreciated.

item.content:encoded:
One day, as I was coming home from school, I started thinking about what I’d pursue in the summer.

Even if I wanted to, I’d not be able to commit to a normal job throughout my school break, so I wanted to focus completely on improving my writing and selling skills.

I definitely know my goal, which is to start creating my foundational income sources to build up my emergency funds and do some good.

I never planned on joining Andrew Tate’s “university”, “school,” or whatever you want to call it.

I’ve seen the potential of networking there, but I wasn’t sure if the information was worth my money. Well…

I’ve enrolled in the “Copywriting Campus,”, and so far it’s mostly just Russell Brunson’s free book…

With one important twist: I really love the quick and rapid teaching method they have used so far. I also like that there’s a clear path for you to take.

So far, it doesn’t feel like too big of a cult—just a normal online community. You don’t really see Andrew himself either; there are so-called “professors” who run these campuses.

I’ve made one rule to keep my curiosity from getting out of control, which happens a lot: I’ll only continue paying if I make back the price of it every month. Worst-case scenario: I’ve wasted my money.

I don’t abuse substances like most Hungarians, so I’m sure this cost me less than a smoking addiction. Obviously, that wouldn’t justify this if I paid for nothing.

I’ll keep you all updated on this journey.
